explanation: tool_params (declaration/definition and its struct/type): The controlling expressions in the function test tool_params.empty, tool_params.medium and tool_params.large. You must see the type, declaration, initialiser and any qualifiers (e.g. const, static, volatile) to determine whether those members are compile-time invariants or modifiable at run-time. process_param__empty: This function likely sets or interacts with tool_params.empty; its implementation is required to know whether tool_params.empty can change (so the 'if (tool_params.empty)' test is invariant or not). process_param__medium: Same reason for tool_params.medium — need to know whether/where medium is set/cleared. process_param__large: Same reason for tool_params.large. process_short_param: One caller of process_param__tiny — you must inspect how it constructs and passes param_name (e.g. literal, buffer, indexing) to determine whether param_name[1] is constant for all calls from this path. process_long_param: The other caller — likewise needed to see what argument value(s) are passed so you can tell whether the ternary controlling expression ('-'' == param_name[1]') can be invariant when invoked from this caller.
